title: What are the parts to an EDM track? - Quora

response.answer_text: EDM - BPM - 120 -148 Parts: 4 on 4 drums - heavy bass, snares, claps, synths, various pianos, hi and lo filter. Intro - typically 8-16 bars. Minor melody is introduced. Vocals. 16-24 - Beat is brought in with accompaniment sounds such as synth additions, backing drums, variation in the melody.  24 - 36 - Melody, Beat, Hook, additional vocals. 36 -48 -  Second Verse. Variations within 4 or 8. 48 - 54 - Bridge 54 - 70 - Third. Variations within 4 0r 8 with a breakdown in beats at 12 or 16. 70 - 86 - Close.

Elements:  Basic rhythm track, Drums, Snares, Hi-Hats, Clap, assorted other percussion, industrial noises. Bass line. Synths for melody. Filler, big sub bass drops, other filler sounds. Structure: big intro for easy mixing, break, main part 1, break, main part 2, long finish to make it easy for DJ's to mix in next track. Depends on what type of EDM, they're all quite different.
